Turkish.title: Turkish Baklava
Turkish.instructions: Mix nuts with sugar and spices. Layer phyllo sheets with melted butter and nut mixture. Cut into diamonds. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Make syrup with sugar, water, honey, cinnamon, and lemon juice. Pour hot syrup over cooled baklava. Let sit for 4 hours before serving.

Turkish.title: Kebab
Turkish.instructions: Marinate lamb with onion, garlic, oil, lemon juice, and seasonings for 2 hours. Thread onto skewers. Grill over medium heat, turning frequently, until cooked through. Serve with pita bread and tzatziki sauce.

Turkish.title: Turkish Delight
Turkish.instructions: Boil sugar, water, and lemon juice until sugar dissolves. Mix cornstarch with water and add to sugar mixture. Cook, stirring constantly, until thick. Add rose water and food coloring. Pour into greased pan and let cool. Cut into squares and dust with powdered sugar.

Turkish.title: Manti
Turkish.instructions: Make dough with flour, water, egg, and salt. Let rest for 30 minutes. Mix filling ingredients. Roll dough thin and cut into squares. Add filling and seal. Boil until cooked. Mix yogurt with garlic and mint. Heat butter with paprika. Serve manti with yogurt sauce and paprika butter.

Turkish.title: Turkish Tea
Turkish.instructions: Boil water in bottom pot of Turkish tea set. Add tea leaves to top pot. Pour boiling water over tea leaves. Let steep for 5 minutes. Serve in Turkish tea glasses with sugar cubes.

Persian.title: Persian Rice
Persian.instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Boil rice with salt until half cooked. Drain and rinse. Mix saffron with warm water. Mix yogurt with eggs and water. Heat butter and oil in pot. Add yogurt mixture and half the rice. Add remaining rice and saffron. Cover and cook on low heat for 45 minutes. Serve with tahdig (crispy bottom).

Persian.title: Kebab Koobideh
Persian.instructions: Mix ground lamb with onion, garlic, oil, lemon juice, and seasonings. Form into long, thin patties around skewers. Grill over medium heat, turning frequently, until cooked through. Serve with basmati rice and grilled tomatoes.

Persian.title: Ghormeh Sabzi
ingredients: 2 cups fresh herbs (parsley, cilantro, fenugreek, leeks)
Persian.instructions: Brown lamb in oil. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Add herbs and cook for 10 minutes. Add dried limes, beans, and seasonings. Add water and simmer for 2 hours until tender. Serve with basmati rice.

Persian.title: Tahdig
Persian.instructions: Soak rice for 30 minutes. Boil rice with salt until half cooked. Drain and rinse. Mix saffron with warm water. Mix yogurt with eggs and water. Heat butter and oil in pot. Add yogurt mixture and half the rice. Add remaining rice and saffron. Cover and cook on low heat for 45 minutes. Serve with tahdig (crispy bottom).

Persian.title: Persian Ice Cream
Persian.instructions: Heat cream and milk with half the sugar. Beat egg yolks with remaining sugar. Temper egg yolks with hot cream mixture. Cook until thickened. Add vanilla and rose water. Chill completely. Churn in ice cream maker. Add nuts and freeze until firm.

Lebanese.title: Lebanese Baklava
Lebanese.instructions: Mix nuts with sugar and spices. Layer phyllo sheets with melted butter and nut mixture. Cut into diamonds. Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Make syrup with sugar, water, honey, cinnamon, and lemon juice. Pour hot syrup over cooled baklava. Let sit for 4 hours before serving.

Lebanese.title: Hummus
Lebanese.instructions: Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, oil, salt, and cumin until smooth. Add water if needed for consistency. Garnish with paprika and parsley. Serve with pita bread.

Lebanese.title: Fattoush
ingredients: 2 pita breads, toasted and broken into pieces
Lebanese.instructions: Combine all vegetables and herbs in large bowl. Add pita pieces. Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve immediately.

Lebanese.title: Kibbeh
Lebanese.instructions: Soak bulgur for 30 minutes. Mix with ground lamb, onion, and seasonings. Knead until smooth. For filling, brown ground lamb with onion and garlic. Add pine nuts and seasonings. Form bulgur mixture into shells. Add filling and seal. Fry in hot oil until golden.

Lebanese.title: Tabbouleh
Lebanese.instructions: Soak bulgur in warm water for 30 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water. Combine with vegetables and herbs. Whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over salad and toss gently. Serve immediately.

Moroccan.title: Tagine
Moroccan.instructions: Brown lamb in oil. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Add tomatoes, dried fruits, nuts, and seasonings. Add water and simmer for 2 hours until tender. Serve with couscous.

Moroccan.title: Couscous
Moroccan.instructions: Heat stock with oil and seasonings. Pour over couscous and let sit for 5 minutes. Fluff with fork. Add raisins and almonds. Garnish with parsley and serve.

Moroccan.title: Harira
Moroccan.instructions: Brown lamb in oil. Add onions and garlic, cook until soft. Add tomatoes, chickpeas, lentils, rice, and seasonings. Add water and simmer for 1 hour until tender. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

Moroccan.title: Pastilla
Moroccan.instructions: Sauté onions and garlic in oil. Add chicken, almonds, raisins, and seasonings. Cook for 10 minutes. Layer phyllo sheets with chicken mixture. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

Moroccan.title: Mint Tea
Moroccan.instructions: Boil water and add tea leaves. Let steep for 2 minutes. Add mint leaves and sugar. Let steep for 3 minutes. Strain and serve in Moroccan tea glasses.
